0860/A0/04/701/012.indicator_name: Policies and measures developed to increase access to equal public services in programme areas

0860/A0/04/701/012.status_value: Achieved - 6 in progress. E.g.: (1) 13th FYP with new vision of child friendly components for the next five years (2016-20)  (2) improved governance and decentralization structure  (3)more equitable financing and budget allocation for MCH and health protection  and basic education  (4)improved financing for nutrition  ECD  sanitation and child protection  (5)enhanced M&E and performance for budgeting in above areas. (6) migrants focus in the above areas
0860/A0/04/701/012.indicator_name: # of significant change processes in governance  financing and budgeting that promote fairness in access to quality essential public services on which UNICEF is engaged with analysis.

0860/A0/04/701/012.status_value: Achieved. 1. an increased evidence-base for effects of local implementation of government special purpose grant programmes on MCH  hospital delivery  maternal nutrition and rural sanitation  2. Dibao mean-testing improvement and performance evaluation framework being established by MoF and MCA   3.clarified reform direction of centralization of spending duties from local levels to central levels on areas such as migrant children's compulsory education in cities  4. Advice to inform the State Cou
0860/A0/04/701/012.indicator_name: # of national/provincial social policy and public financing and budgeting frameworks and plans which incorporate key recommendations resulting from inputs in the areas above.

0860/A0/04/705/052.indicator_name: % of HIV-positive pregnant women who receive ARV to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission (B=65%: T=75%)

0860/A0/04/705/052.status_value: 85%. Intervention at early stage of pregnancy especially to pregnant women who are migrants  ethnic minority and living in remote mountain areas will be strengthened in next few years
0860/A0/04/705/052.indicator_name: % of HIV-positive pregnant women who receive ARV to reduce the riskfor MTCT in pilot county.

0860/A0/04/705/052.status_value: Achieved ¿ 18 000. Local policy development to support children without caregivers and Hukou registration will be strengthened in the next two years (note: the poorest children is defined as children who meet government criteria for economic support)
0860/A0/04/705/052.indicator_name: Number of the poorest children received any form of external economic support in pilot sites.

0860/A0/04/705/053.indicator_name: Percentage of young women and men aged 15¿24 who correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission of HIV and who reject major misconceptions about HIV transmission in pilot sites(B=60%: T =90%)

0860/A0/04/705/053.status_value: Achieved ¿ 4.5M. Significant increase in information seeking on HIV  SRH  condoms was achieved via the condom promotion campaign and World AIDS Day activities at national and provincial level.
0860/A0/04/705/053.indicator_name: # of adolescents seeking RH/STI/HIV info on IT platform (by number of hits)

0860/A0/04/705/053.status_value: Achieved ¿ 5 000. To date  counselling was provided to over 5 000 adolescents on HIV  STI and pregnancies through Wechat  QQ chat group and Blue & Red Ribbon Centers  and the number keeps on increasing. Over 85 000 adolescents covered through outreach activities.
0860/A0/04/705/053.indicator_name: # of adolescents in pilot areas seeking HIV-SRH services

0860/A0/04/705/051.indicator_name: % of children receiving early infant diagnosis for HIV.

0860/A0/04/705/051.status_value: Achieved - 5. the implementation plan was issued by MCA for 89 counties to develop community child welfare director for providing better support services to children and cash assistance to vulnerable children with government fund
0860/A0/04/705/051.indicator_name: Number of sub-national policies developed with increased domestic funding for 4Ps in line with the New National Strategic HIV Plan (2011-2016)

0860/A0/04/705/051.status_value: Achieved - 7. Four policy proposals were drafted and submitted to the State Council by SCAWCO and three were adopted. The adopted policy proposals include: strengthening treatment  livelihood and education of children affected by AIDS  school-based service providing on HIV counselling  test  reporting  and care for students  public fund with high proportion of government funding set up for civil society organization application to work on HIV/AIDS Prevention and Care. The policy proposal on fund
0860/A0/04/705/051.indicator_name: Number of National policy proposals been submitted to central government and adopted with increased domestic fundings for 4Ps in line with the New National Stategic HIC Plan (2011-2016)

0860/A0/04/702/021.status_value: Achieved ¿ 79%. After one year of implementation  99% of children received YYB  and 79% of children were given YYB in the past 24 hours  thus achieving the target  a 33% decrease in prevalence of anaemia was observed in one of the pilot areas (48%)  whereas anaemia remained at 75% elsewhere. The other surveys will be conducted in January 2016.
0860/A0/04/702/021.indicator_name: % poorest caretakers feed their child 6-24 months daily with Ying Yang Bao in selected pilot areas in Qinghai.

0860/A0/04/702/021.status_value: Achieved. The Food Safety Expert Committee of NHFPC has approved the standards.
0860/A0/04/702/021.indicator_name: Policy for multiple micronutrients in pregnant women available. MOV:notification by GoC
% poorest caretakers feed their child 6-24 months daily with Ying Yang Bao in selected pilot areas in Qinghai. MOV: routine monitorig

0860/A0/04/702/022.status_value: Partially achieved - ongoing. Updating the national vaccine regulation contents and process is complex. NHFPC has requested UNICEF's continued support on AEFI compensation mechanism research in 2015  with the compensation for AEFI study completed in Hebei province.
0860/A0/04/702/022.indicator_name: Revised National vaccination regulation available. MOV: Notification by GoC

0860/A0/04/702/022.status_value: Achieved. A joint working group between UNICEF  WHO and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation was established with a focus on the introduction of new and underused vaccines. UNICEF documentation on child immunization in China 40 years document and on-going research has helped the government to re-draw attention on EPI policy development.
0860/A0/04/702/022.indicator_name: Joint WHO/UNICEF advocacy document for introduction of new vaccines (Hib  pneumococcus  rota  etc) available

0860/A0/04/702/023.status_value: Achieved. Development of national child survival strategy is completed. At least one provincial strategies are to be completed by end of December in 2015.
0860/A0/04/702/023.indicator_name: # provincial child survival strategies developed (modeled on the national child survival strategy)

0860/A0/04/702/023.status_value: The routinely reported difference between the average hospital delivery rate in UNICEF supported pilot sites in Tibet and Sichuan now tentatively stands at 19.7%. Thus the target has been achieved  noting that data from 6 counties are still missing.
0860/A0/04/702/023.indicator_name: Difference of average hospital delivery rate between worst performing pilot sites (Tibet and Sichuan) and best performing pilot sites

0860/A0/04/702/025.status_value: Achieved. The action plan has changed title as national child injury working guidelines and will be issued by NWCCW nationwide
0860/A0/04/702/025.indicator_name: National action plan for CIP developed. MOV: Notification by GoC

0860/A0/04/702/025.status_value: 295 schools and kindergartens covered (denominator not available)
